DOC.brief_summary: In 5-year , two-site randomized clinical trial , propose test efficacy CATCH-IT primary care/Internet base depression prevention intervention Attention Monitoring Psychoeducation ( AMPE ) prevent onset depressive episode intermediate high risk group adolescent age 13-17 . We plan ( ) identify high risk adolescent base elevated score PHQ-A , screen measure depressive symptom ; ( b ) recruit 400 ( 200 per site ) at-risk adolescent randomize either CATCH-IT AMPE group ; ( c ) ass outcomes 2 , 8 , 12 , 18 , 24 month post intake measure depressive symptom , depressive diagnosis , mental disorder , measure role impairment education , quality life , attainment educational milestone , family functioning ; ( ) conduct exploratory analysis examine effectiveness intervention program , moderator protection , potential ethnic cultural difference intervention response .
DOC.brief_title: Primary Care Internet-Based Depression Prevention Adolescents ( CATCH-IT )
DOC.criteria: Youth age 13 17 . Youth must experience elevate level depressive symptom Center Epidemiologic Studies Depression46 ( CESD ) scale ( score > /= 16 ) least two core symptom Major Depression Patient Health Questionnaire , Adolescents . Youth include past history depression , anxiety , externalize symptom , substance abuse . Current DSMIV diagnosis ( Kiddie Schedule Affective Disorders ) Major Depressive Disorder , current therapy depression , take antidepressant ( e.g. , SSRIs , TCAs , MAOIs , bupropion , nefazodone , mirtazapine , venlafaxine ) . Current CESD score > 35 DSMIV diagnosis schizophrenia ( current past ) bipolar affective disorder Current serious medical illness cause significant disability dysfunction Significant reading impairment ( minimum sixthgrade read level base parental report ) , mental retardation , developmental disability Serious imminent suicidal risk ( determine endorsement current suicidality CESD KSADS interview ) condition may require immediate psychiatric hospitalization Psychotic feature disorder , currently receive psychotropic medication Extreme , current drug/alcohol abuse ( great equal 2 CRAFFT ) .
